arm_group.description: split-face single-blind randomized placebo-controlled trial evaluating improvement in facial skin laxity of the side of the face with placebo versus laser

brief_summary.textblock:
We study the efficacy of 1 pass of stacking pulses of long pulse 1064nm laser on the face
      for skin tightening immediately post laser and 3 months follow up.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Long Pulsed 1064nm Laser for Facial Skin Tightening

detailed_description.textblock:
To study the efficacy on facial skin tightening and wrinkle reduction after a single pass of
      double stacking pulses of long pulse 1064nm laser on the face in skin types III-V
      immediately post procedure and at 3 months. The study is a split-face placebo-controlled
      single-blind study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ages 35-60 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. History of skin malignancy

          2. Patients on immunosuppression

          3. Patients with other known internal malignancy

          4. Patients with malnutrition, vitamin or mineral insufficiency

          5. Patients on colchicine, penicillamine

          6. Patients with weight loss 7.5% of usual body weight within 3 months

          7. history of botulinum toxin injection within 6 months

          8. history of facial filler injection within 1year

study_pop.textblock: healthy adults with visble signs of aging

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized-controlled Split-face Treatment of Facial Rhytids and Laxity in Asians Using Long-pulse 1064nm Laser

overall_official.affiliation: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital
